monthly_spend_analysis_data.ai_summary: Your total income for January was $5,200, and your total spending was $4,249.57, which is 81.72% of your income. The largest expense category was rent and utilities at $2,200 (42.31% of income). You spent $170.34 (3.28%) on food and drinks, $65 (1.25%) on transportation, and $289.98 (5.58%) on entertainment and general merchandise. While your investment contribution of $1,500 is commendable, you may want to review your discretionary spending on items like clothing and electronics to better align with your goal of building credit history.

In February 2023, your total income was $5,200, and your total spending was $2,390.23, which is approximately 46% of your income. The largest expense category was rent and utilities at $1,800 (34.6% of income). Food expenses, including groceries and restaurants, totaled $163.25 (3.1%). Entertainment and personal care expenses were $152.99 (2.9%). Transportation costs were $35 (0.7%). While your spending is within a reasonable range, there are opportunities to optimize your budget. Consider reducing discretionary expenses like entertainment and personal care. Explore more affordable housing options to lower your rent burden. Build an emergency fund and contribute to a retirement account to secure your financial future.

In March 2023, your total income was $5,200, and your total spending was $1,977.23, which is around 38% of your income. Your major expenses were rent ($1,200), transportation ($120), and entertainment ($185.99). While investing in retirement funds ($200) is commendable, you could optimize your budget by reducing discretionary spending on dining out, entertainment, and personal care. Consider cooking at home more often and finding affordable entertainment options. Additionally, explore ways to lower your transportation costs, such as carpooling or using public transit.

In April 2023, your total income was $5,200, and your total spending was $4,208.73, which is 81% of your income. Your largest expenses were rent ($2,100), investment ($1,500), and clothing ($180.5). To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, clothing, and dining out. Focus on building your credit history by making on-time payments and keeping your credit utilization low.

categories_expenses.ai_summary: In April 2023, your total income was $5,200, and your total spending was $4,208.73, which is 81% of your income. Your largest expense was rent at $2,100 (40% of income). You spent $65.5 (1.3%) on restaurants, $42.75 (0.8%) on gas, $129.99 (2.5%) on electronics, $25 (0.5%) on coffee, $180.5 (3.5%) on clothing, and $75 (1.4%) on entertainment. To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on electronics, clothing, and entertainment. Additionally, explore ways to lower your rent or utilities costs. Maintain your retirement contributions and build an emergency fund.
